com.sony.felica
Interface Type3TagConnection

All Superinterfaces:
javax.microedition.contactless.TagConnection
public interface Type3TagConnection
extends javax.microedition.contactless.TagConnection

This interface provides access to a NFC Forum Type 3 tag.

Each Type 3 tag has at least one system code. The system code of a tag identifies the authority which issued the tag. Tags may also have multiple partitions, each having a distinct system code.

The unit of information used for memory management on Type 3 tags is called a block. Each block has a size of 16 bytes. Blocks are not addressed directly, instead blocks are assigned to so called services and the corresponding service code must be used for addressing. The application needs to have knowledge about the available services, service codes and the number of blocks associated to each service.

Method Detail

select

void select(int systemCode)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                   javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
Selects a partition matching the specified system code. A Type 3 tag may have different partitions each having a distinct system code. The partition selected by default is the first partition of the Type 3 tag (the primary partition). This method can be used to select another partition.

Parameters:
systemCode - the system code of the partition to select. The system code must be a 2 byte number (0 < system code > 65535).
Throws:
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if no matching partition for the specified system code can be selected
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the system code is not valid

getSystemCode

int getSystemCode()
                  throws javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
Retrieves the system code of the currently selected partition. The partition which is selected by default, is the primary partition of the Type 3 tag. The select() method can be used to select another partition. If, after calling the select() method, the system code can not be verified, this method may return the system code that was used as parameter to the select() method.

Returns:
The system code of the currently selected partition of the Type 3 tag.
Throws:
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if there was an error communicating with the Type 3 tag

getIDm

byte[] getIDm()
Retrieves the IDm of the currently selected partition of the Type 3 tag. The IDm (manufacturer ID) is a number uniquely identifying each partition of a Type 3 tag. The lenght of the IDm is 8 bytes.

Returns:
The IDm of the currently selected partition of the Type 3 tag.

getICCode

int getICCode()
Retrieves the IC code of the current target. The IC code is a unique number for the IC chip and the software version used on the Type 3 tag.

Returns:
The IC code of the Type 3 tag.

check

byte[] check(int serviceCode,
             int[] blockList)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                    javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
Read memory blocks from the Type 3 tag. All blocks must belong to the same service. The service can be specified using its service code. The blockList contains the numbers of the blocks to read.

Parameters:
serviceCode - the service code
blockList - the list of blocks to read
Returns:
the data of the specified blocks. For each block in the block list 16 bytes of data are returned. The order of the data is the same as specified in the blockList parameter
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the parameters is null or the service code is invalid
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if there was an error during processing the command

update

void update(int serviceCode,
            int[] blockList,
            byte[] data)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                   javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
Write data to the Type 3 tag. The data is written to one or more blocks belonging to a single service. The service can be specified using its service code. The block list contains the numbers of the blocks to write. For each block number in the blockList, a data block of 16 byte must be provided and the order of data blocks must be identical to the order of block numbers in blockList.

Parameters:
serviceCode - the service code
blockList - the list of blocks to write
data - the data to write to the specified blocks.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the parameters is invalid or null or if the number of data bytes is not equal to blockList.length * 16.
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if there was an error during processing the command
